title: Strictly's Saffron and AJ admit struggles as back injury halts rehearsals
text:
Saffron is on the mend after back injury halted rehearsals (Picture: BBC/Getty)

Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard are feeling the Strictly pressure as the YouTuber was forced to quit rehearsals yesterday after injuring her back.

The 20-year-old online megastar appeared in good spirits as she joined AJ at the Global Gift Gala on Thursday evening, but admitted the injury had set them back.

And with the shock exit of Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell last weekend, the pair know that every minute counts when it comes to rehearsal time.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk on the red carpet, Saffron admitted: ‘It definitely has affected it, we haven’t been able to do as many hours as we would have liked to, from what we have done previously.

‘It’s only getting harder, the competition. So we have struggled. But we’re getting through it. Our last day has been successful.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘We just can’t get it done as many times,’ AJ added. ‘We’ve just got to be efficient, getting it done, and then going for dinner!’

As for last week’s controversial elimination, which left some viewers threatening to boycott the show, the pair are all too aware that the judges scores count now more than ever as the number of participants remaining dwindles.

‘I think it just shows that nobody’s safe and that even one of the most natural dancers can go home, people go home,’ AJ said. ‘For us, it’s the same thing we give it everything and don’t allow anything to happen.

‘We have to be on the top of the leaderboard, we have to work harder.’

More: Strictly Come Dancing Amanda Holden, David Walliams, Caroline Flack dazzle at Global Gift Gala Strictly Come Dancing's Kevin Clifton missing from tour as pro line-up is announced Strictly Come Dancing judge Motsi Mabuse genuinely wasn't aware podcasts are 'a thing'

Saffron was injured during Saturday’s contemporary dance performance to Celine Dion’s Because You Loved Me.

This week, they’re set to take on the Foxtrot to New York, New York by Frank Sinatra.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Saffron Barker was forced to quit Strictly Come Dancing training with AJ Pritchard after injuring her back in Saturday's live show.
